description: The Central Board of Secondary Education has opened the registration window for the CTET February 2026 cycle, with applications accepted online until 18 December 2025. Candidates must complete form submission and fee payment before the deadline. The exam will be held on 8 February 2026, with Paper-II in the morning and Paper-I in the evening.

Dharmendra prayer meet: Bobby Deol looks emotional; Rekha, Sidharth Malhotra & others pay respect
description: Bollywood's beloved Dharmendra was honored with a 'Celebration of Life' on November 27th, following his passing on November 24th, 2025. Family, including Bobby and Sunny Deol, alongside industry stars like Sidharth Malhotra and Jackie Shroff, gathered at Taj Lands End. Sonu Nigam performed iconic songs, reflecting Dharmendra's joyful spirit. Hema Malini shared a heartfelt tribute, remembering his enduring legacy.

description: Chiefs tight end Noah Gray has been ruled out for Week 13 after missing all practices with a concussion. Kansas City now turns to Robert Tonyan and Jared Wiley behind Travis Kelce as the team faces Dallas on Thanksgiving. Here’s what Gray’s absence means for the Chiefs’ rotation, their offensive plan, and Thursday’s high-pressure matchup.

Notably, Australian captain Alyssa Healy went unsold, surprising many as the auction unfolded for the 2026 WPL season.

title: 'Next step UCC': CM Sarma after Assam bans polygamy; who is exempted?
description: The Assam Assembly has passed the Prohibition of Polygamy Bill, 2025, banning polygamous marriages across most of the state and imposing penalties for violations. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma stated the law is not against Islam and aims to promote true Islamic practices. The bill excludes Sixth Schedule areas and Scheduled Tribes.

Haley, who advocates for strict immigration policies and has faced scrutiny over his own loyalty, is increasingly vocal on the right. This online spat highlights a growing divide within conservative politics.

description: A Bangladesh court has handed former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina a 21-year prison sentence in three corruption cases concerning land allocations. This verdict follows a separate death sentence for her role in last year's protests. Her son and daughter also received prison terms. Hasina, in exile in New Delhi, denies the charges, calling them politically motivated.

Worried about your lungs amidst rising pollution? 3 ways to test them at home
description: The breath-holding test provides a fast method to evaluate your lung capacity together, with breathing control abilities. Take a deep breath before you attempt to hold your breath, for as long as you can. People with healthy lungs usually manage to hold their breath between 30 to 50 seconds. Your doctor needs to evaluate your lung capacity when you cannot hold your breath for more than 20 seconds

description: Winter's low sunlight hinders vital vitamin D production, impacting immunity and bone health. Experts advise smart sun exposure, prioritizing midday for brief periods, and considering skin tone. Since sunlight alone is often insufficient, incorporating vitamin D-rich foods and supplements, guided by medical advice, is crucial for maintaining optimal levels throughout the colder months.

Users are urged to watch for phishing attempts and bolster account security.

description: India is set to open its nuclear energy sector to private companies. This move aims to boost energy security and technological advancement. The government plans to increase nuclear power capacity significantly by 2047. A new bill will be introduced to facilitate this major policy shift. This reform follows the successful opening of the space sector to private players.

description: The Supreme Court has directed comedian Samay Raina and three others to host shows featuring specially-abled individuals with inspiring stories. These events aim to raise funds for the treatment of persons with disabilities, with the CJI emphasizing this as a social responsibility for well-placed individuals. The directive comes amid a plea against comedians for insensitive remarks about people with disabilities.

11 killed in China: Train runs over rly workers; what went wrong?
description: Tragedy struck in China's Yunnan province as a test train collided with railway workers, claiming 11 lives and injuring two. The devastating incident occurred during a seismic-detection equipment test at Luoyang Town railway station. Authorities have launched an inquiry into the cause of this severe rail accident, the region's worst in over a decade.

title: Building Bengaluru 2.0: City bets whopping Rs 1.5 lakh crore on its infrastructure
description: Bengaluru plans a massive Rs 1.5 lakh crore infrastructure overhaul to become a global metropolis. The ambitious project includes urban tunnels, elevated roads, metro expansion, and improved waste and water management. While aiming to ease traffic, critics question its car-centric approach and environmental impact, advocating for greater public transport investment.

title: Blake Lively Avoids Taylor Swift ‘Smear Campaign’ as Travis Kelce Stays Silent
description: Hollywood's once-tight Blake Lively-Taylor Swift friendship appears strained, with Lively's recent social media silence fueling speculation. This distance is reportedly linked to Lively's legal battle with co-star Justin Baldoni, which inadvertently involved Swift. Insiders suggest Swift is working to rebuild trust, indicating a complex, human dynamic behind the public perception of a feud.

title: It wasn’t easy”: Gisele Bündchen opens up about shock over Brady’s past
description: Supermodel Gisele Bundchen revealed the shock of discovering Tom Brady's ex was pregnant just two months into their relationship. Despite this, they married and she embraced his son, Jack. After over a decade of marriage, the couple announced their separation in October 2022, with Bundchen now a mother again and Brady reportedly single.

title: Candace Owens pulls show, claims Macron tried to harm her after Kirk’s death
description: Candace Owens has halted her show, alleging French President Macron plotted her assassination, a claim she reported to the White House and US counterterrorism teams. She also implicated the Macrons in Charlie Kirk's death. These accusations surface amidst a defamation lawsuit filed by the Macrons against Owens for her claims about Brigitte Macron's gender identity.

title: 'Only one will win': Mark Cuban warns AI giants— 'overspending bubble could pop'
description: Mark Cuban has cautioned major AI firms like OpenAI and Google against excessive spending in the race for the most powerful models. He likens the current AI arms race to the 1990s search engine boom, predicting a potential bubble and winner-take-all outcome. Cuban believes true disruption will emerge from unexpected breakthroughs, not just incremental improvements.

title: Vascular surgeon shares one simple exercise for people with peripheral artery disease
description: A vascular surgeon successfully treated a young patient at risk of leg amputation due to PAD with a structured intermittent walking program. This exercise regimen, involving brisk walking intervals followed by rest, promoted collateral artery growth, significantly reducing pain and restoring mobility, ultimately avoiding amputation.

title: Google chips threaten Nvidia: Stock drops $250B; claims 'we lead industry'
description: Nvidia's dominance in AI chips faced a significant challenge as Meta reportedly considers billions in spending on Google's competing AI processors. This news sent Nvidia's stock plummeting, while Alphabet's shares climbed. Google's TPUs are emerging as a credible alternative, potentially disrupting Nvidia's market hold.
